about_the_game:
You live inside a mechanical ladybird called a Clomper, which you can control by building pipes to power machines with steam.



The outside world is a hellscape, which you explore from inside the Clomper. Completing quests keep the world alive, collecting resources to build better pipe networks to make your Clomper easier to use. Explore to unlock better pipes.



The world is procedurally generated, making the landscape surprising and fresh. Currently very simplistic pre-alpha developer graphics, which will be replaced before the demo.



Clomper is a solo dev project by Rob Lang that has been built in the open with over 60 devlogs on YouTube!

Planned Features for Demo

Here is a list of features that the demo will include. Those that are ticked have been completed. If you like a little proof, then check out the YouTube devlogs.

  • Create pipes to power machines ✅
  • A claw to pick up things from the outside world ✅
  • Procedurally generated landscape ✅
  • Periscope for looking outside ✅
  • A delivery quest ✅
  • Pick up scrap from the world and grind it into resources ✅
  • Manage boiler heat else they might explode! ✅
  • Inventory to spend resources on new pipes ✅
  • Graphics refresh ⬅️
  • Unlock new pipe types
  • Game mode sliders to tune the game difficulty
  • Accessibility options

name: Clomper
short_description: Drive your mechnical ladybird across a procedural hellscape by building pipes to power machines with steam. Explore from inside the submarine-like Clomper: collecting resources, completing quests and repairing damage. Go solo or with a friend with co-op multiplayer.
